Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different habitats, showing places on land like a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot, and places in water like a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can include drawings of various living things found in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can illustrate comparisons between the different types of living things in different habitats.
The student can use their drawing to show patterns in the diversity of plants and animals across habitats.
